intro: Godetia quadrivulnera, commonly known as the four-pierced godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
